data.meta_description: Jordan Shankle (17) Defender - As a Senior (2017) Made 18 appearances, 16 of which were starts for the Red Storm… played a key role on a Red Storm backline t...
data.text:
As a Senior (2017)

Made 18 appearances, 16 of which were starts for the Red Storm… played a key role on a Red Storm backline that led the BIG EAST and finished 15th nationally with a 0.71 goals against average… helped the Johnnies register eight shutouts on the season… played 1,443 minutes on the year… scored one goal, the game winner, in a 1-0 clean sheet over Seton Hall (Sept. 16)… his goal against the Pirates came from just inside midfield… played 90 or more minutes 10 times.

As a Junior (2016)

Made appearances in all 17 games for the Red Storm, including 16 starts… played 90 minutes or more in 11 of those contests… registered five shots, two of which were on goal… logged the full 110 minutes in a scoreless draw with Drexel to open the season… played full contests in back-to-back games against Saint Peter’s (Aug. 31) and Syracuse (Sept. 4)… recorded a shot on goal in 110 minutes of action in the BIG EAST opener against Marquette (Sept. 17)… played the full 90 minutes in consecutive victories against Seton Hall (Sept. 24) and Saint Joe’s (Sept. 27)… recorded 110 minutes in the Red Storm’s 1-1 draw with No. 10/14 Creighton (Oct. 1)… fired off a shot and played the full 90 minutes in the Johnnies’ win over No. 11/14 Butler (Oct. 15)… recorded 90 minutes at Villanova (Oct. 26)… tallied full-game efforts against DePaul (Oct. 29) and Providence (Nov. 3) to end the season.

At Richland College (2015)

Appeared in 19 games, including 16 starts … finished with one goal and five assists … helped lead a defense that posted seven shutouts as part of a 15-4-1 season … squad won the District C Championship and finished third at the NJCAA Division III National Championship.

At Northeast Texas C.C. (2014)

Appeared in 23 games, including 22 starts … totaled five goals, one game-winner, and three assists … helped Eagles reach the NJCAA Division I National Tournament and finish 17-4-2.
